method.name: PUT
method.doc: To update the current administrator settings, issue a PUT request to the administrator configuration endpoint. If an administrator setting is missing from the JSON payload it will have the affect of unsetting that tuning parameter.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: oldPassword
param.doc: The old administrator password. Required if changing the password.

param.name: newPassword
param.doc: The new administrator password. Required if changing the password.

param.name: confirmPassword
param.doc: Confirmation of the new administrator password. Required if changing the password.

param.name: minHeapSize
param.doc: The minimum heap size, in megabytes, for the JVM.

param.name: maxHeapSize
param.doc: The minimum heap size, in megabytes, for the JVM.

param.name: sessionTimeout
param.doc: The length of time, in minutes, that a session can remain idle before it is deleted (valid values: 0 - 720). A default value of 120 is used.

param.name: sessionInactiveTimeout
param.doc: The length of time, in minutes, that a session can remain idle before it is deleted (valid values: -1 to 720). A default value of 30 is used. A v alue of -1 disables the inactivity timeout.

param.name: sessionCachePurge
param.doc: The interval, in minutes, that the cleanup of stale session cache entries is performed (valid values: 0 - 720). These are entries where the period since the last access time is greater than the sessionTimeout value. A default value of 30 is used.

param.name: httpPort
param.doc: The TCP port on which the LMI will listen.

param.name: httpsPort
param.doc: The SSL port on which the LMI will listen. A default value of 443 is used.

param.name: sshdPort
param.doc: The port on which the SSH daemon will listen. A default value of 22 is used. Please note that if using the appliance clustering capability all nodes in the cluster must be configured to use the same port for the SSH daemon.

param.name: sshdClientAliveInterval
param.doc: The number of seconds that the server will wait before sending a null packet to the client. A value of -1 means using the default timeout settings.

param.name: swapFileSize
param.doc: The amount of allocated swap space, in Megabytes. There must be enough disk space on the active partition to store the swap file, otherwise an error will be logged in the system log file and the default amount of swap space will be used. (only present in the response if a value has been set).

param.name: minThreads
param.doc: The minimum number of threads which will handle LMI requests. A default value of 6 is used.

param.name: maxThreads
param.doc: The maximum number of threads which will handle LMI requests. A default value of 6 is used.

param.name: maxPoolSize
param.doc: The maximum number of connections for the connection pool. The default value is 100.

param.name: lmiDebuggingEnabled
param.doc: A boolean value which is used to control whether LMI debugging is enabled or not. By default debugging is disabled.

param.name: consoleLogLevel
param.doc: The console messaging level of the LMI (valid values: INFO, AUDIT, WARNING, ERROR and OFF). A default value of OFF is used.

param.name: acceptClientCerts
param.doc: A boolean value which is used to control whether SSL client certificates are accepted by the local management interface. By default SSL client certificates are accepted.

param.name: validateClientCertIdentity
param.doc: A boolean value which is used to control whether the subject DN contained within an SSL client certificate is validated against the user registry. By default validation is disabled.

param.name: excludeCsrfChecking
param.doc: A comma-separated string which lists the users for which CSRF checking should be disabled. Regular expressions are accepted, and any embedded commas should be escaped with the '' character. This option is required if you wish to access a Web service, using client certificates for authentication, from a non-browser based client. An example might be: cn=scott,o=ibm,c=us,cn=admin,o=dummyCorp,c=*.

param.name: enableSSLv3
param.doc: Enable SSLv3 support for the local management interface. By default SSLv3 support is disabled.

param.name: enabledServerProtocols
param.doc: Specifies which secure protocols will be accepted when connecting to the LMI. The value should correspond to a supported IBMJSSE2 option. The current supported options include: SSL_TLSv2, SSL, TLSv1, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2.

param.name: enabledTLS
param.doc: List of Enabled TLS protocols for the local management interface in the format enabledTLS:["TLSv1", "TLSv1.1", TLSv1.2"].

param.name: maxFiles
param.doc: The maximum number of log files that are retained. The default value is 2.

param.name: maxFileSize
param.doc: The maximum size (in MB) that a log file can grow to before it is rolled over. The default value is 20.

param.name: httpProxy
param.doc: The proxy (<host>:<port>) to be used for HTTP communication from the LMI. The port component is optional and will default to 80.

param.name: httpsProxy
param.doc: The proxy (<host>:<port>) to be used for HTTPS communication from the LMI. The port component is optional and will default to 443.

param.name: loginHeader
param.doc: This is a customizable header that is displayed when accessing the login page in a web browser and after logging in via SSH. Multiple lines of text can be specified by using the sequence "n", which will be interpreted as a line break.

param.name: loginMessage
param.doc: This is a customizable message that is displayed when accessing the login page in a web browser and after logging in via SSH. Multiple lines of text can be specified by using the sequence "n", which will be interpreted as a line break.

param.name: accessLogFormat
param.doc: The template string to use for the LMI access.log file. If not set the access log is disabled (default).

param.name: lmiMessageTimeout
param.doc: This is a timeout (in seconds) for notification messages that appear in the LMI. A value of 0 indicates that the messages should not timeout. The default value is 5 seconds.

param.name: validVerifyDomains
param.doc: This is a space separated list of valid domains for IBM Security Verify. These domains are used by the IBM Security Verify wizard to ensure that only valid hostnames are used.
